text: The United States Army chief information officer/G-6 (CIO/G-6) was a dual role, reporting both to the secretary of the Army as CIO, and also to the chief of staff of the Army as G-6.LTG Robert Ferrell, USA Army CIO/G-6 overview 15 Feb 2015 The roles were realigned in 2020. LTG Bruce T. CrawfordLTG Bruce Crawford - USA Bio February 2020 retired as the Army chief information officer/G-6 on August 11, 2020. In June 2020, the Army announced that CIO/G-6 would be split into two roles, CIO and G-6.US Army (June 2020) Army realigns Chief Information Officer positions A major general has been selected as Army CIO, and will serve as deputy G-6, while receiving a 3rd star.Andrew Eversden and Mark Pomerleau (15 July 2020) Morrison nominated for one the Army’s top IT jobs ==As CIO== #Report directly to the secretary of the Army #Set strategic direction and objectives for LandWarNet #Supervise Army command, control, communications, computers, and IT (C4IT) #Manage enterprise IT architecture #Direct delivery of C4IT in support of warfighting and enterprise requirements #Assess and ensure compliance of IT security and national security systems ==As G-6== #Advise chief of staff of the Army on planning, fielding, and execution of C4IT worldwide Army operations #Develop and execute the plan for the Global Enterprise Network #Implement Army information assurance #Supervise C4IT, Signal support, Information security, Force structure and equipping activities in support of warfighting operations #Oversee management of the Signal forces ==Planned realignment== On June 11, 2020, the Army announced that the two roles of CIO and Deputy Chief of Staff, G-6 (DCS, G-6) would be realigned no later than August 31, 2020 with separate individuals responsible for each position.. With the realignment: *CIO core functions will be policy, governance, and oversight. Focus areas include: Information Environment, Cybersecurity, Enterprise Architecture, and Data Policy/Oversight/Governance, Enterprise Architecture, Enterprise Cloud Management and IT Spend/Category Management. *DCS, G-6 core functions will be planning, strategy, and implementation. Focus areas include: Information Environment/Network, Planning and Integration, Theater Synchronization, Architecture Integration, Enterprise Information Environment (EIE) Mission Area Portfolio Management and Mission Decision Packet Management.
